intro: Pseuderanthemum ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pseuderanthemum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features elliptical, opposite leaves that are usually less than 5 cm in length. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters. Pseuderanthemum ellipticum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
